page.title: 08Priory
page.content: {The Priory,}founded in 12 century, is mostly in ruins, except for the nave of the church and the gate house. The church has been repaired and restored. The roof and the stained glass windows have been repaired, the floor has been replaced; the organ has been restored; the vestry, the font, and organ console have been moved; and new heating put in. Some of the medieval floor tiles have been laid under the medieval high altar, now near the organ. The west tower had a roof, windows, and a glass door for the first time, in 1985. The builders found human bones under the floor. The Priory is a{tourist}attraction. The medieval infirmary is now the Rectory House,and the gate house is a {shooting lodge.}
